solution_02_probability/01_overview/q4_perm_v2

video

This scenario describes a permutations problem (order matters). We are considering the nonrepeating sequences of size 3 from a set of size 22.

\[\begin{aligned} {_nP_r} &= \frac{n!}{(n-r)!} \\\\ n &= 22 \\\\ r &= 3 \\\\ {_{22}P_{3}} &= \frac{22!}{(22-3)! } \\\\ &= \frac{22!}{19!} \\\\ &= 22\cdot21\cdot20 \\\\ &= 9240 \end{aligned}\]
